page.title: 03CUTTESLOWE WALLS
page.content: There had always been a fence which separated the council estate at Cutteslowe from the privately owned houses. In December 1934 this fence was strengthened into a wall at great inconvenience to the council estate residents.They complained and were supported by the Communist Party.This led to an enquiry in July 1936. In 1938 the walls were demolished but the city were immediately told to rebuild by the private residents in a court order. In 1943 the walls were knocked down by a tank on manoeuvres and were again rebuilt.They were finally demolished in 1959.
